ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I got to strengthen my screenwriting skills and my collaboration skills. This class is all very hands-on -- in creating my Thesis, I learned how to Direct a short film, how to manage a set of 15+ people, how to lead a cast and crew in a fun and efficient way. I learned how to edit in Da Vinci Resolve. Continued to learn how to be a good listener and give creative/writing advice to my peers.
Developing a piece from square one, workshopping story, brainstorming solutions to production hurdles

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths - Jon is the best, and everyone who takes this course gives 100% effort and honest, helpful feedback. It's a great group of people and Jon creates a really supportive and open environment. Plus, I found it very fun! 

Weakness - might benefit from 2 two hour sessions per week instead of one 3.5 / 4-hour block. Could also benefit from more support and communication from the Arts / extra funding from Yale / more importance placed on this course and the Film Major by Yale.
In no other course at Yale within the film department will you have the opportunity to truly cultivate an idea from beginning to end, and create a short film tailored to you.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments:
Yes - if they are passionate about filmmaking and writing and Directing -- and want to make a short film for their Senior Thesis - yes!! 
It's fun, challenging, creative, engaging, and exciting. Definitely a lot of work, but since it is a year-long course, you would know this before signing up.
